South Africa's Oscar Pistorius has made history by becoming the first man to run in the Paralympics and Olympics.
And he did it in flying style.
The man dubbed "The Blade Runner" came second in his 400 meters heat,...
...crossing the line in 45.44 seconds, and comfortably securing his place in the semifinals.
The 25-year-old described the race as mind-blowing,...
...a sentiment shared by many of his fellow athletes who dismissed a long-running disagreement...
...of whether his prosthetic legs were in fact an advantage.
